column1: report

CLINICAL HISTORY: Chest pain.
FINDINGS:
The cardiac silhouette is normal in size.
There is no pleural effusion.
Pulmonary vasculature appears within normal limits.
There is no focal consolidation.
Mediastinum is unremarkable.
No acute displaced rib fracture identified.
A right-sided central venous catheter tip projects over the SVC.
IMPRESSION:
No acute cardiopulmonary abnormality.

CLINICAL HISTORY: Shortness of breath.
FINDINGS:
The cardiac silhouette is mildly enlarged.
There is a small left pleural effusion.
Pulmonary vasculature appears mildly congested.
There are patchy bibasilar opacities.
Mediastinum is widened.
No acute displaced rib fracture identified.
A left-sided central venous catheter tip projects over the right atrium.
IMPRESSION:
Findings concerning for mild pulmonary edema.

CLINICAL HISTORY: Cough.
FINDINGS:
The cardiac silhouette is borderline prominent.
There is a trace right pleural effusion.
Pulmonary vasculature appears prominent.
There is a right upper lobe opacity.
Mediastinum is stable compared to prior.
No acute displaced rib fracture identified.
A midline central venous catheter tip projects over the cavoatrial junction.
IMPRESSION:
Right upper lobe opacity may represent infection; correlate clinically.

CLINICAL HISTORY: Fever.
FINDINGS:
The cardiac silhouette is normal in size.
There is no pleural effusion.
Pulmonary vasculature appears within normal limits.
There are no focal consolidations.
Mediastinum is unremarkable.
No acute displaced rib fractures are seen.
A right-sided PICC line terminates over the SVC.
IMPRESSION:
No acute cardiopulmonary process.

CLINICAL HISTORY: Trauma from fall.
FINDINGS:
The cardiac silhouette is mildly enlarged.
There is a small right pleural effusion.
Pulmonary vasculature appears mildly congested.
There are patchy left basilar opacities.
Mediastinum is widened.
No displaced rib fractures appreciated.
A left chest port catheter tip overlies the right atrium.
IMPRESSION:
Mild pulmonary congestion with small effusion.

CLINICAL HISTORY: Hypertension.
FINDINGS:
The cardiac silhouette is borderline enlarged.
There is a trace left pleural effusion.
Pulmonary vasculature appears prominent.
There is a right lower lobe opacity.
Mediastinum is stable compared to previous exam.
No acute displaced rib fractures detected.
A midline catheter tip overlies the cavoatrial junction.
IMPRESSION:
Findings may represent early pneumonia.

CLINICAL HISTORY: COVID exposure.
FINDINGS:
The cardiac silhouette is normal in size.
There is no pleural effusion.
Pulmonary vasculature appears within normal limits.
There are faint bilateral interstitial markings.
Mediastinum is unremarkable.
No evidence of acute fracture.
A right-sided central line tip projects over the SVC.
IMPRESSION:
Possible viral pneumonia.

CLINICAL HISTORY: Post-operative follow-up.

IMPRESSION:
Mild pulmonary edema pattern.
